page.title: 11DOUNE PONDS NATURE RESERVE
page.content: { Doune Ponds}used to be a{sand quarry before it was turned into a nature reserve. It has three different ponds and each looks very different. The first pond you come to is about the smallest and near the middle is a 4-5m. long island. The second pond has trees all around it and a raft near the middle which is used by swans and coots. The last pond has some reeds at the back where birds can nest. This year the coots are nesting on the raft and the mute swans are nesting in the reeds. There are all types of trees and bushes, Willow, Myrtle, Rowan, Wayfaring tree and Birch, most of them planted by Doune Nature Club and children from our school. On your visit you will most likely see coots, mute swans, whitethroats, willow warblers, robins, swallows and swifts.
